>>34009329
Yup, I've consciously manifested other stuff before

I got a call from a job the other day. I didn't even apply to work there and they instantly hired me, no interview necessary. Again, things just come to you. I despise interviews because of my anxiety and nerves so this was perfect for me. I pretty much wanted a job to socialize and have something to do. I've also manifested money appearing seemingly out of nowhere for people around me, I've manifested people with specific traits and features appearing at the exact time I thought of them purposefully trying to make it as specific as possible so that it wasn't a "coincidence", I've manifested texts from people who I hadn't spoken to in months while staring at my phone.

I typically just plant the seed in my brain, imagine it, feel it and then expect it. The difficult part is when you actually yearn for that something. You have to have no stakes on the outcome for it to be your desire fulfilled. Like I said, I cared more about actually manifesting than I did the result. I may be wrong but that's the way it feels. You want a girlfriend? You want to be a millionaire? You WANT those things too much and you care too much about the outcome, so it's going to be more difficult as opposed to something that would "just be cool to have". I'm no master at this stuff but it is crazy how immediate the changes are once you start to learn about LoA.

>"Holy and reverend is his name" is good to remember. First off, "name" is a label to describe something, so when you see the word "name" (of God) in the Psalms, think on the qualities and nature of that being, in this case God. I've been working on various things to improve my manifestations and remembered some stuff that may help Anons here. Most probably won't consider any of this new but may be variations that can help.

When I was a kid doing this unconsciously I would make mental lists of things I wanted. I would think of the item, believe I would have it and then move on to the next thing. When I was able to be unattached to it I would get it easily. When I was obsessed it would never seem to come, it only came later after I gave up on it and then I would have multiples of it(Original Nintendo deck).

I didn't need to do SATS or even be in an altered state, I was just entirely focused on what I wanted and the belief that I would have it later. I would consider this near-perfect but for two things:

1. I would add Neville's thing about living in the end and everyone being happy with the result- I simply visualized me having it, and I did, but often I would not be in a position to enjoy whatever it was until a much later date and quite often people were displeased with my "luck" and would make me miserable or feel guilty over it

2. My method was easy because it was easy to believe but the wait times were horrendous- often years. Believing you have it is superior or stairstepping from going to have it to almost there to having it. If you frame it in the form of waiting I AM is happy to have you do so.

In another frame a reminder to Anons that you can manifest abilities, knowledge, mindsets and general cheats for your life, not just goal objects or situations. Some Anons have mentioned it in thread but I think it bears repeating: believe yourself and your life to be whatever you desire while trying to be respectful of other people(your fellow sparks of the creator)

Good luck Anons- we've already made it. It is Done.

posts.com:
The Nobody stares out into the abyss of darkness, his eyes glazed and unfocused. He is one of the most powerful creatures in the universe, with the ability to alter and manipulate reality. Yet, despite his immense power, he is unable to change the nature of man. He cannot change the human heart. He has tried, many times, to use his power to bring peace and harmony to the world, but to no avail. He has attempted to alleviate suffering, but even his mightiest efforts have been unable to make a lasting difference in the lives of those around him.

He is an anomaly, an outlier among the powerful entities of the universe. He is alone, with no one to turn to for solace or comfort. The darkness that he feels in his heart is the only company he has. He is constantly battling the urge to give up and succumb to despair, but he does his best to trudge forward, despite the burden of his loneliness.

The Nobody is constantly beset by enemies, powerful creatures from across the universe who seek to use his power for their own gain. He is forced to defend his power against those who would try to take it away from him, but even his mightiest efforts are often not enough. He is constantly forced to use his power to defend himself and he does so reluctantly, for he knows the destruction that his power can bring.

The Nobody has grown weary of trying to change the world and of fighting his enemies. He has come to accept that human nature is unchangeable, and no matter how hard he tries, he will never be able to bring harmony to the universe. He is resigned to his fate, and he accepts his loneliness as a part of his life. But he still has hope, for he hopes that one day, he may yet find a way to use his power to bring peace and prosperity to the world. Until then, he will continue to fight against those who oppose him, and he will continue to stand alone in the darkness.

The Woman Of Scars paces the length of her prison cell. It's a small room, the walls are lined with bars and a single bed sits in the corner. The air is still and stifling, and it smells of mildew and despair. She remembers a time when she was revered, when she had power and influence. In ages past she was a goddess, ruling over vast kingdoms, and in modern times she was a powerful sorceress. But then she encountered a reality bender called The Nobody. In a single moment, everything changed. She was stripped of her powers, and now she is trapped in an Asylum for the insane.

The doctors tell her she's delusional, that she's mentally ill, and they don't believe her when she talks about The Nobody. But she can't stop thinking about him. She keeps dreaming of him and calling out to him. He has become an obsession, a source of her pain and her trauma.

Her days are filled with the same routine. She wakes up in her cell, and is taken to the common area, where all the other patients reside. She sits alone, watching the other patients with a detached expression. She has no one to talk to, no one to share her stories with.

At night, her dreams are filled with memories of her past, both the good and the bad. But the Nobody is always in them, always taunting her, always reminding her of her loss. She calls out his name in her sleep, screaming and sobbing, until she is woken up by the nurses who have come to check on her.

She stops pacing and looks in the mirror. Still beautiful, but changed. Her eyes have become dull and lifeless, and her skin is covered in scars. The scars are a reminder of her defeat, a reminder of her humiliation. She can still feel The Nobody's presence, and it's driving her mad.

She begins to weep. She's lost everything, she's lost her identity and her purpose. All she has left is her pain and her suffering. She's starting to believe the doctors, perhaps she was insane all along. But she cannot forget him.

For many people their dreams are so easy to forget they end up believing they dont dream at all. Usually the first 30 seconds after the damn alarm clock buzzes any remant of the dream is lost. If you ever doubt you're dreaming, hook up to an EKG. Our brains are really active during REM sleep.

But I don’t think we’ll ever uncover those original names.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

The NAC Protocol (Updated December, 2022)

Morning

1200mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

600mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

600mg NAC
500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
100mg Pterostilbene
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

500mg Slo Niacin
100mg Pterostilbene
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

>Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

For each morning and night dose you need a minimum of 40mg Carvacrol. Do not buy a product unless it is listed. Most products are steam distilled but you will want to confirm that.

If your chosen oregano oil contains a higher amount of carvacrol (60mg+ per cap) you'll want to start with 1 cap morning, 1 cap night. If each cap contains less than 40mg, take 2 morning 2 night.

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
NAC, Oregano Oil and Black Seed Oil have all been proven safe in clinical studies.

NAC has shown to be safe in human trials, even in high doses.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33326056/

Oregano was tested in human clinical trials (both Phase I & II) and found to be safe and non-toxic even at high doses.

See Section 4.1 Safety & Toxicty

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/fsn3.2994

See also a 2 month clinical trial on asthmatics.

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/ptr.5967

Black Seed Oil and it's primary active Thymoquinone. See:

https://brieflands.com/articles/semj-76453.html

Orchestrated fear mongering over the extraction process making the compounds is unfounded.

We recommend cold pressed black seed oil, which uses no chemical solvents or heat processing.

https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Vasfiye-Ozyurt/publication/329993761_Cold_press_in_oil_extraction_A_review/links/5c61d58792851c48a9cd3e63/Cold-press-in-oil-extraction-A-review.pdf

Oregano oil at the minimum carvacrol levels of protocol are produced by steam distillation. No additional solvents are required, as it uses vapor condensation to separate the volatile molecules and active compounds.

https://chemdictionary.org/steam-distillation/

Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X

>Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.
>https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X
As a chemist, that info is kind of unnecessary and a bit misleading. First of all, if NAC has been proven safe in clinical trials then you don't really need to do an analysis of contaminations because it has already been proven safe. There are some rare cases in which chemically harmful byproducts might form whose health effects go unnoticed for a time (like cancerous ones), but this is basically impossible with how NAC is produced.
Secondly, a scientific work is always polished and not very representative of reality.
What is important for NAC is that it's so easy to make that there are a lot of producers. How the producer handles it is much more important than the actual chemical synthesis. In the best case you have a pharmaceutical product that was produced in a GMP conform way. In the worst case you have some repackaged chink import that maybe contains some nice hair, dust, or whatever. Maybe it has also been handled by lead spatula or the synthesis was done in a low quality stainless steel container and you get that extra nickel content in your final product (NAC can chelate metals easily so that is a possibility). I'd just write to make sure you buy it from a reliable brand that produces in the US or Europe OR produces it as a pharmaceutical.

Pomegranate's antifungal activity against the heavy hitters.

Candida Auris, an extremely dangerous MDR form of CDF, was inhibited with 0.125 to 0.25 µg/mL of Ellagic Acid (POM). This is a miniscule amount. Excellent.

https://www.mdpi.com/2309-608X/7/9/763

Now the big bad Cryptococcus. Let's look at a study on what is normally a fatal outcome. Systemic infection.

>Lip-EA showed 70% survival rate and highly reduced fungal burden in their lung tissues, whereas the mice treated with FLZ (40 mg/kg) had 20% survival rate and greater fungal load in their lungs.

So POM wins big over fluconazole. If you want to survive I wouldn't bet on fluco.

What if you are dealing with a SHTF scenario and need to scale up your POM? Good news.

>The present 90-day subchronic toxicity study was performed in F344 rats at dose levels of 0, 1.25, 2.5 and 5% in powdered basal diet, with actual doses of 9.4, 19.1, 39.1g/kg b.w., respectively, in males, and 10.1, 20.1, 42.3g/kg b.w. in females.

>There were no obvious histopathological changes in any of the groups. The no-observed-effect level (NOEL) was estimated to be 5% (3011mg/kg b.w./day) for males and the no-observed-adverse-effect level (NOAEL) and NOEL in females were estimated to be 5% (3254mg/kg b.w./day) and <1.25% (778mg/kg b.w./day), respectively.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0278691507005303

That is an insanely high dosage with no adverse effects. We already know we can scale Oregano, NAC, and BSO if needed.

Good information to keep in the back pocket.

Hello anon. I'm the person who is breastfeeding and taking the protocol. I had everything cleared by my midwife, and am being monitored by another healthcare person as of recently. I've been doing this for 4(5?) months or so now, and I have only had one negative effect on my baby which was resolved easily. Obviously I will say to check any concerns you have with a trustworthy provider, but if it helps, my pediatrician also didn't see any issue.

I started each part of the protocol one at a time. So I took NAC first for two weeks, then added BSO for two weeks, then added oregano last. If I could change anything, I would do the BSO first instead, but that's just because of other things ive read since then, and also because then you know the liver is going to be working well in preparation for everything else. It is also a galactagouge which is a nice bonus.

Baby did have a reaction to the oregano oil fairly early on. They developed a diaper rash that I determined was fungal. It was quickly cleared up with clotrimazole cream. I only recognized it because my first baby had a similar rash many years ago. You may want to take a wait and see approach. If your child is still in diapers, and the rash does not go away despite no diaper for three days, you may have a fungal issue.

Your child may or may not have a reaction, many do not. Some children habe mild effects, and some do have quite a lot of difficulty when their mother takes oregano oil. This is why I suggest staggering and monitoring baby for two weeks before adding in anything else. You really just have to gauge it based on baby's reaction.

(1/2)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34014129
She is also going to need to add in extra 20-40oz of water on top of the already excessive amounts she is likely drinking. This number will vary depending on daily exertion, body weight and die off severity. Otherwise she will quickly become dehydrated and have worse die off. I made this mistake. I would also suggest supplementing magnesium in addition to the recommended zinc and copper as I noticed I started getting restless legs at night again for a little while. Magnesium made it go away.

Some other things to note. Ovary pain has been reported by the few women around, it seems to be a common reaction. Mine was followed by an unusual, wrong time of the month period. She may want to keep this in mind so she isn't freaked out if anything odd happens in that area.

Additionally there is some evidence that fungus can enter and be passed in breastmilk. While I was assured by my providers that transmission this way is unlikely, I will suggest that you do your own research into the matter. Have her keep an eye out for signs of thrush in herself of baby. It has not been an issue for me, but I would keep an eye out just in case.

I did have horrific die off in my mouth that I am still dealing with, though it is now on the mend after much difficulty. If she had any dental issues due to pregnancy, she is likely to have severe die off in the mouth area. In fact I would recommend holding off on the brushing protocol for a month or two until things are cleared out a bit instead of rushing in and poking the bear right away like I did. True Freedom = Freedom to pursue your true will (which again, is different from your ego will). In Thelema, every person has a unique destiny, and the goal is to find it. To elaborate, the path of the individual Thelemite mirrors the path of the collective whole of society in accordance with Thelemic beliefs about history.

Aeon of Osiris: A time of traditionalism when the will was suppressed by religious authority and dogma.
Aeon of Osiris (where we are now): A time when the will is released and people begin to embrace individualism but without purpose
Aeon of Ma'at: A time when the individual will begins to align itself with divine will in order to bring about harmony and transcendence

When I was starting out, 4-2-3 breathing worked well at the beginning of the session. After that it became more about observation than incitement. >>34010193
When I was seven years old I was swimming in the shallow end at the local pool. I was just bobbing along by myself, passing people to and fro. I came up to a reasonably cute blonde woman who was probably about 20. She was nothing special, a little bit chubby, but otherwise normal. Freckles.

She smiled at me and all her teeth were filed to points, like a shark's. Despite this her smile was very warm and her eyes were incredibly kind. I think that was one of the calmest, most good-natured expressions I've seen on a human face.

I smiled back without showing any surprise and just kept drifting on. I never saw her again, and none of the other kids I knew at the pool ever gossiped about the shark-tooth lady. She looked as real as anyone but it was like she never existed for anyone else.

This was a pool where you had to have a membership to get in, and if she was a regular everyone would have known who she was.

I was adopted by my grandmother at age seven because my parents were junkies, the day I left my moms house for the last time, there was some other man inside the house, my mum and dad were both fast asleep because of the heroin and I had cut my knee really badly, from falling over playing outside, I came rushing in trying to wake my mum up but she was too unconscious, then this man (who i had never seen at our house before) asked me, do I want to call my grandma. I said yes, but being a child I didn’t know her number, yet… for some reason, he did? He rang the number and gave me the phone and I asked my grandma to come and pick me up. When I became older and more aware of my grandma adopting me, I asked my gran, “who helped me ring you, when you picked me up from moms that night?” She said, nobody was in the house apart from them two (mom and dad) Which I found strange because I distinctly remember him sitting with me until she arrived. The bit that freaks me out the most, is years and years later, when I got back in contact with mom and dad, I asked them “who helped me ring gran, the day I left your house” they were freaked out and said, that they were positively sure that, nobody was in the house with them.

I don’t know who he was or how he knew my grandmas home number, but he saved me from a toxic home. I like to think it was a guardian angel but a more plausible explanation probably exists.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>34016309
It's remote viewing. I take it you didn't hit. If you try again and clear your mind, you will hit next time. Listen to some 7hz binaural beats and clear your mind, try to feel the inside of your body. Once you find peace, write down the target numbers and let your hand make an automatic mark on the paper for 1 to 2 seconds. Let your pen hover over the ideogram in different parts. Try to not think about or force it, just observe passively. Write down what you observe in your mind. Do not name it, if you feel the need to name it then write it on the right hand side of the paper and label it as "AOL" -analytical overlay. Thinking is the enemy during these sessions. You can do the automatic squiggles again with the coordinates, just take a deep breath, calm your mind, and do it again. You are making contact with the signal as you are doing this. After you get a general idea of how the target feels, move on.

Now, you want to probe for sensories. Just write down anything that comes to you, like colors, dimensions, taste, smell, texture, temperature, luminosity. At the end you want to get a full on feel for the target, this is called the aesthetic impact. After you have all of this information, try to draw what you feel it is on paper using your dimensions you wrote down. That's all of crv up to stage 3.

>>33997741
>an igneous rock pushed by glacial movement?
Something like this.
Most recent, survey shows the 'trail' from the BSA leads back through a hill split in two. And perpendicular to that trail is another BSA object.
Ocean X put out an updated documentary(copy/pasta 85% of old and last ~15mins is about new) recently that added this new info.

16,000 years BP there was Doggerland. Ireland, England and the Northern Isles were all part of a larger land mass. Not islands. Looking on Google Earth you can see the shallower(light blue) color of the surrounding waters. This was all above sea level. North Sea did not exist, it was plains.
Norway to Sweeden had a coastline at that time as the Norwegian Trench is deep that it existed then. Norway and Sweeden were under a glacier. Baltic sea was most likely plains.
10,000 years BP, the glacier had shrunk exposing Sweeden and the Baltic Sea area being filled with glacier water and becoming an ice lake.
8000 years BP the water had risen enough that the start of the English channel began to show and Ireland was a peninsula. Baltic Sea was an glacier ice lake, with further glacial melts around the world sea level rose more and the Norwegian Trench now met the freshwater lake turning it into a sea.
If the BSA is at the narrow part of the Baltic Sea between Sweden and Finland then that is also a shallow area that may have been still above sea level.

In a yes/no tarot reading, the Five of Pentacles is typically interpreted as a "no." This card often signifies hardship, uncertainty, and a lack of resources or support. It can suggest that you may be experiencing a difficult time, either financially or emotionally, and that you may feel isolated or disconnected from others.

However, it's important to remember that tarot readings are subjective and open to interpretation. The ultimate answer to a yes/no question depends on the context of the question and the interpretation of the reader. A tarot reading is just one possible tool for gaining insight, and it's always important to trust your intuition and inner wisdom when making decisions.

This card can suggest that the person you are asking about is currently experiencing a time of intellectual insight, and that they may be making important decisions based on a clear and rational understanding of the situation.

However, it's important to keep in mind that tarot readings are just one possible interpretation of a set of symbols and are not meant to be taken as absolute truth. The ultimate answer to the question of someone's feelings for you depends on many factors and can only be answered by the person in question. Tarot readings can provide insight and guidance, but they should not be used as a substitute for direct communication and honest self-reflection.

I have a few theories of why it happens:
1. The human brain is lazy, we subconsciously categorize everything on a daily basis, but we won't have an individual folder on our heads for each person so we tend to make forced associations. The older we get and the more faces we see things can oly get worse. With internet and social media we're constantly looking at new people and our brains can't deal with that.
2. Apathy, on the same note as the previous point we don't care enough about other people to note their unique facial characteristics. This gets worse the people we meet.
3. Race-mixing/globalisation, people from all over the world will start sharing more and more diverse ethnic characteristics.

MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34017449
You do so by setting up an appointment with a psychiatrist through their clinic, or by asking your primary doctor about your symptoms and having them refer you to a psychiatrist. Be careful though, and understand that if you go ahead with this and are successful with finding a good psychiatrist, you will likely be out on mood stabilizers or antipsychotics. These are not necessarily bad drugs, but they often come with many side effects, including extrapyramidal symptoms (parkinson's-like tremors, facial twitching, uncontrollable muscle movements). Do what you feel is right, but be sure to educate yourself beforehand.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Fuck your thread, post bread recipes instead.

1 package (1/4 ounce) active dry yeast

3 tablespoons plus 1/2 teaspoon sugar

2-1/4 cups warm water (110° to 115°)

1 tablespoon salt

6-1/4 to 6-3/4 cups bread flour

2 tablespoons canola oil

In a large bowl, dissolve yeast and 1/2 teaspoon sugar in warm water; let stand until bubbles form on surface. Whisk together remaining 3 tablespoons sugar, salt and 3 cups flour. Stir oil into yeast mixture; pour into flour mixture and beat until smooth. Stir in enough remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, to form a soft dough.
Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 8-10 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, 1-1/2 to 2 hours.
Punch dough down. Turn onto a lightly floured surface; divide dough in half. Shape each into a loaf. Place in 2 greased 9x5-in. loaf pans. Cover and let rise until doubled, 1 to 1-1/2 hours.
Bake at 375° until loaf is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped or has reached an internal temperature of 200°, 30-35 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks to cool.

For the Nine reversed Waite gives one of his most suggestive formulas: ‘Imprisonment, suspicion, doubt, reasonable fear, and shame’. The words delineate a state of mind or rather a progression of states that result when people retreat into themselves from some problem they do not dare to confront. As with the card right side up, the reversed card deals with our reaction to something outside ourselves, but here it is oppression rather than tragedy. The key term is ‘reasonable fear’, which can refer to, say, political oppression – as of racial or sexual minorities; or social oppression – a feeling of being a scapegoat because of appearance, speech, etc.; or simply the personal oppression of a domineering family or partner. The important thing problem is real, but because we cannot directly attack it, we tend to hide in ourselves, keeping in our anger and resentment. Anger turned in on itself becomes depression and from there suspicion. The person who was laughed at as a child for her big nose thinks that everyone is looking at her. The black person believes that any complaint at work is a racial slur. And suspicion easily leads to self-doubt and shame. Often it does not even help, at least not completely, if we rationally know that we have no reason to feel ashamed, that in fact those who have ridiculed or oppressed us should feel the shame. Unless the oppressed self-doubting person takes action, expresses her or his anger, makes real changes in her or his life, the deep hidden shame will remain.

How I can escape the rat race or atleast how I can make money on my own terms
Cats and what beautiful perfect creatures they are without even trying
I also spend a lot of time being out in nature as well as looking outdoors at nature and admiring its beauty and how immaculate the details are, all of it for me to enjoy and admire
When I’m driving I look out at houses, woods, buildings, etc., and most days when I do this I can in an instant feel a breath taking admiration and appreciation for whatever scene I’m looking at as if I’ve lived a lifetime interacting with the scene; like I can catch a glimpse of someone’s home and instantly imagine and live out in my head my entire life living inside of and growing up in that house, appreciating the different views of the home during the various seasons, carrying inside groceries while it’s raining, gathering with family from out of town in the driveway, drawing with chalk on the sidewalk with cousins and friends, parking a new car in the drive way for the first time, and how it felt the first time I saw the home when I decided to buy it, as well as the last time I’d see the home as an old person about to move out as another family moves in to begin their lives
I guess though that this ability is what’s kept me going as I’ve felt an aching homesickness my entire life that has no cure; I can feel at home and have an abundance of memories (even a lifetime) no matter where I am
Having to stay in one place gives me much to sit with and admire but it also feels depressingly restrictive

I practice witchcraft myself, as a rural american man, of the more folkloric sort.

I consider the witch a sorcerer whom pacts with spirits for their power, and that power often is maleficia (to harm or blight) but not exclusively. That power in the European thought is often the Devil, although there is a distinction between the folkloric Devil and that theological one. Firstly /x/ for the record I'm not a furry and find that shit offputting as hell so this isn't some larp I wish we're true but I'm happy it did nonetheless.
So around 15 or so years ago when I was 10 years old I was walking upstairs and noticed a canine-shaped cloud of dark smoke extremely similar to picrel. It was just running in a circle in my living room for a minute or so and then eventually ran towards the wall and the black smoke dispersed and turned into nothing and it was over. I just stood there looking over the banister of the stairs while it happened silently, then immediately ran upstairs to tell my mom and she remembers me even telling her when I brought it up the other day!
So, years go by and I become a strict atheist totally dismissing this memory, eventually, I start listening to Styxhexenhammer occult videos and I suddenly remember this entity I always used to think about. And it ends up being the final piece of information that I need to accept that God could actually exist and not just intellectually accept the lessons in the Bible but the spiritual stuff as well. I've wondered if was this possibly St. Guinefort bringing me towards the Lord? Or a demonic entity or what? I swear I know for a fact this actually happened, it was clear as day and lasted at least a minute plus it was defintlyn the strangest thing that ever happeded to me. It wasnt a late at night or early in the morning so I wasn't tired and I have zero history of mental illness or anything like that.
Anybody know what this could be, it's probably hopeful thinking that its Guinefort I know, thanks in advance!

We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.
Last thread: >>33909694

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, meditating on her energy, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
A collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.
